cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then northeast, skirting the North and South Carolina coasts on Sunday and then accelerating offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward the open Atlantic early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina–South Carolina border (around Myrtle Beach, SC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts along the coasts of South Carolina and North Carolina with lesser effects possible farther north along the Mid-Atlantic shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (5%) chance of 34-kt winds for Boston late Tuesday; breezy conditions possible but damaging winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston as the storm remains well south and offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light to moderate rain possible Tuesday–Wednesday, but heavy rainfall totals over 4 inches are not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and increased rip-current risk along the Massachusetts coastline early next week.
